text: Colin Trevor Pillinger, (9 May 1943 - 7 May 2014) was a British planetary scientist at the Open University. He was the main investigator for the British failed Beagle 2 Mars lander project. He also worked on a group of Martian meteorites. He was born in Kingswood, South Gloucestershire. Pillinger died from a brain haemorrhage on 7 May 2014 at the Addenbrooke's Hospital in Cambridge, Cambridgeshire. He was 70. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1943 births Category:2014 deaths Category:British astronomers Category:British chemists Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:Members of the Order of the British Empire Category:Academics of the Open University Category:People with multiple sclerosis
title: Colin Pillinger
